title: Timothy Gowers
summary: Sir William Timothy Gowers, FRS (/ˈɡaʊ.ərz/; born 20 November 1963)[1] is a British mathematician. He is Professeur titulaire of the Combinatorics chair at the Collège de France, and director of research at the University of Cambridge and Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge. In 1998, he received the Fields Medal for research connecting the fields of functional analysis and combinatorics.[3][4][5]
